answers.answer: The night sweats are most likely caused from the diabetes- the red patches may or may not be.Your stiff neck in combo with the lethargy lead me to think it could possibly be mono or perhaps some sort of virus. It could take several weeks for a virus to completely works it's way out of your system- maybe longer if you don't have your diabetes under control.You may want to post your question in the diabetes forum- they would be able to tell your more about the diabetic issues.Good Luck

question: I am 35 and for the last couple of months I have awoken with a stiff and sore neck.  It doesn't really go away through out the day.  I've switched pillows, slept w/o a pillow just to see if it would help, but no...I have onset diabetes.  My fasting blood sugar is somewhere between 115-145.  I do get night sweats of various degrees.  Some nights are drenching, and some are just a cold sweats.  I've associated this with the diabetes. I am not over-weight.  I'm 6' 2" and about 195-205lbs. I have red dry patches on my arms.  I am always tired, but I get up to put the dog out and to put the 2yr old back to sleep.  So my sleep is always disrupted and with a 2nd baby on the way, I don't see that getting better.For Christmas I had the stomach flu along with my wife and 2 yr old.  Needless to say, it wasn't the greatest Christmas.  About a week later I got a cold - sore throat, cough, congestion.  That hasn't gone away.  I've taken Zicam and Tylenol Cold and it didn't do a thing.  I am thinking allergies?  But nothing as far as eating habits and weather has really changed except the company name I work for.Can this all be related to the diabetes?  I am suppose to get another blood test done, every 6 months the doctor said.  I presently have 3 brothers and neither parent, aunt, uncle or sebling has or had diabetes.  Just my Grandpa when he was in his upper 50's along with various other issues.  My mother had MS but passed away when I was 17.
title: Stiff Sore Neck last 2 Months, Cold Symptoms last 6 Weeks, Lathargic, Night Sweats, Dry Red Patches on Arms (Eczema)
